thread.title: Tottenham winger Chadli out for six weeks with ankle injury
thread.title_full: Tottenham winger Chadli out for six weeks with ankle injury

author: How Chicago police 'disappeared' 7,000 people
title: Tottenham winger Chadli out for six weeks with ankle injury
text:
Tottenham winger Chadli out for six weeks with ankle injury FOXSports 4 hrs ago Â© Getty Images LONDON, ENGLAND - OCTOBER 17: Nacer Chadli of Tottenham Hotspur is taken off by a stretcher after injury during the Barclays Premier League match between Tottenham Hotspur and Liverpool at White Hart Lane on October 17, 2015 in London, England. (Photo by Michael Regan/Getty Images) Nacer Chadli is expected to be out for six weeks after scans revealed he damaged ankle ligaments at the weekend.
AdChoices The Tottenham winger was stretchered off during Saturday's goalless draw with Liverpool after he was involved in an eighth-minute collision.
And a club statement on Tuesday revealed the diagnosis and a recovery time of "around six weeks".
That timescale would likely rule Chadli out of seven games, including three in Europe and London derbies against Arsenal and West Ham.
And it would also make the Belgian touch-and-go for Chelsea's visit to White Hart Lane on November 29.
Chadli, who has featured 11 times for Spurs this season, joins Heung-Min Son, Nabil Bentaleb, Ryan Mason, Tom Carroll and Alex Pritchard on the injured list.
